description: As the season turns to autumn, Makoto and the other members of S.E.E.S. inch ever closer to the end of their battles with the Shadows. Through the battles, some must face the deaths of friends and family, some must notice what precious things must be protected, and some must find meaning in the conflicts that have occurred.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

title.native: PERSONA3 THE MOVIE —#2 Midsummer Knight's Dream—
PERSONA3 THE MOVIE — #4 Winter of Rebirth —

node.description:
Music composer of many Atlus videogame titles, he joined the company in 1995.

He left Atlus in September of 2021.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.
Currently works at Atlus. Main character designer for Persona 3 onwards.

__[Website](https://www.lotusjuice.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lotusjuice)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/groups/lotusjuicefanclub/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lotusjuice/)__

__Biography:__
 Lotus Juice, otherwise nicknamed アニキ (Aniki) is a Japanese rapper, known to be one of the pioneers in rap for official Japanese anime and game music. His rap music consists of 90's Hip Hop, J-Pop, Dub, Rock, Comedy, Love and many more. He is well known for his works with Shoji Meguro from ATLUS Japan, ripping the mic on the track "Mass Destruction" in the game Persona 3. 

He has been traveling around the world from Argentina, Mexico, to USA performing at anime and game conventions in front of his international fans. His unique flow has caught attention from [Taku Iwasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100172/Taku-Iwasaki), and their collaboration has gained substantial recognition.

(Source: [Lotus Juice's Official Website](https://www.lotusjuice.com/profile-english/))

Kozue Kananiwa graduated from the HOSEI University of Tokyo, Faculty of Letters, Department of Japan Literature. Her first work as a producer was for [Oh! My Goddess](https://anilist.co/anime/50/Aa-Megamisama-TV/) in 2005.

Since, she participated in the production many renown series such as [Mahou Shoujo Madoka☆Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Mahou-Shoujo-MadokaMagica/) in 2011, [Steins;Gate](https://anilist.co/anime/9253/SteinsGate) the same year, or more recently [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/Horimiya/).

Now, she is the General Manager of  both U-NEXT Anime & Book Division and of the Production Department.

(Source : Bangumi 番組計画RC3)

[Profile (Kick Factory)](https://www.kic-factory.co.jp/yumitama/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/YumiKawamura)

Yumi Kawamura is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger previously affiliated with the record labels Cutie Zaurus (2017), Kick Factory (2014), Istvan Media (1992–1993) and Toshima EMI (1996–1997). 

She is best known for singing the opening and ending theme songs, as well as some background music, in Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 and Shin Megami Tensei: Persona PSP.
